law.catch_line: Fire, explosives, electric devices, gas, smoke to take wildlife prohibited.
law.text: No wildlife may be taken as the result of a fire, or any type of explosive, or with the aid of any mechanical, electric or hand operated sonic recording devices, except as specified by regulation. No person shall use smoke or gas or in any other way molest or destroy the den, hole or nest of any wildlife, nor shall any person burn a field for the purpose of driving game, except employees or agents of the department in carrying out investigational, research or improvement projects.
law.history: Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 265, sec. 16, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 273, sec. 5. -- Amended 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 38, sec. 19. -- Amended 1956 Ky. Acts ch. 115, sec. 16. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 200, sec. 49. -- Created 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec 15.
